feed.title: O'Brien Family Cookbook
feed.subtitle: A collection of cooking recipes from the O'Brien family

entry.title: Detroit Style Pizza
entry.summary:
For Christmas last year Madeline bought me a LloydsPan Detroit Style Pizza Pan which I use for this recipe.
You can probably use another type of pan that’s roughly the same dimensions.
This recipe calls for Brick cheese, which is a cheese available

entry.title: Pizza Sauce, 3 Ways
entry.summary:
All sauces come directly from Ken Forkish’s The Elements of Pizza, which is an excellent book for learning about pizza.
Simple Sauce Ingredients:
1 twenty-eight(28) ounce can of whole tomatoes 8 grams of fine sea salt
FWSY Sauce Ingredients:

entry.title: Bomb Roasted Cauliflower
entry.summary:
Made at least once a week in the Marin O'Brien household.
Ingredients:
1 head cauliflower, cut into florets (the smaller the size will get crispier they will be) 2 Tbsp. olive oil 1 tsp. garlic powder 1 tsp. ground cumin ½ tsp. black pepper 1 ½

entry.title: Grain Salad with Honey Mustard Dressing
entry.summary:
“It’s so damn good!” - Aunt Maddy
Ingredients:
½ butternut squash diced ½ cup cooked quinoa ½ cup cooked farro ½ cup cooked black rice 3 cups arugula roughly four handfuls ¼ cup pomegranate seeds ¼ cup pine nuts 3.5 oz feta cheese
Grain Salad

entry.title: Alfajores with Coconut Dulce de Leche
entry.summary:
Madeline thinks this is the best thing she’s ever baked.
It’s easiest to spread on round cookies, although holiday specific shapes do look nicer.
Ingredients:
1 14-oz. can sweetened condensed milk 1 13.5-oz. can unsweetened coconut milk 2 tsp.

entry.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
entry.summary:
Tommy submits his family’s modified Chicken Tikka Masala recipe. A true classic.
Ingredients
5 pounds bone-in chicken pieces (breasts, legs, or a mix), skin removed; or 3-4 boneless, skinless chicken breast if you prefer. 3 tablespoons toasted ground
